PText: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
RText: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

PText: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
RText: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

PText: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
RText: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

PText: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
RText: ¶I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

PText: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
RText: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

PText: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
RText: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

PText: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
RText: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

PText: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
RText: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

PText: Yet for love's sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
RText: Yet for love's sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

PText: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
RText: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

PText: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
RText: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

PText: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
RText: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

PText: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
RText: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

PText: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
RText: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

PText: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
RText: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

PText: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
RText: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

PText: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
RText: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

PText: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;
RText: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;

PText: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
RText: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

PText: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
RText: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

PText: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
RText: ¶Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

PText: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
RText: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

PText: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
RText: ¶There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

PText: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
RText: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

PText: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
RText: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen. Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus, a servant.
Footnote: Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus, a servant.
